meanings.definition: Total or partial paralysis of one side of the body.
meanings.sent1: After the accident, he experienced hemiplegia on his left side.
meanings.sent2: The doctor explained that hemiplegia can affect movement on one side of the body.
meanings.sent3: During the game of charades, he hilariously acted out hemiplegia on one side.
meanings.sent4: Her fear of failure was like a heavy hemiplegia weighing down her progress.
meanings.sent5: The image of a half-frozen lake mirrored the hemiplegia of his right arm.

meanings.definition: A condition resulting from a stroke or other brain injury.
meanings.sent1: The patient's hemiplegia was caused by a stroke last year.
meanings.sent2: Doctors are researching new treatments for hemiplegia following brain injuries.
meanings.sent3: In the comedy show, the character exaggerated his hemiplegia for laughs.
meanings.sent4: The city's economic downturn felt like a collective hemiplegia affecting its growth.
meanings.sent5: The artist's painting depicted the chaos of the mind through swirling colors resembling hemiplegia.
